means: 使衰弱，使失去活力( enervate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Warm winds make many people feel enervated and depressed.
sentence.Network_cn: 暖风让很多人觉得乏力沮丧。
她由于生活放荡不羁而气虚体亏。

sentence.Network_en: The long march in the sun enervated the soldiers.
sentence.Network_cn: 在太阳下长途的行军,使士兵们渐失精力.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新东方教育科技集团 > 新东方 > 详细信息 ... Pretentious 自命不凡的 Enervated 无力的，衰弱的 Devoid 缺乏的，全无的.
pretentious 自命不凡的enervated 无力的，衰弱的devoid 缺乏的，全无的
20 ebullient 沸腾的，热情洋溢的21 enervated 无力的衰弱的22 spacious 宽敞的
You ' ll probably feel enervated , paralyzed , as though you ' ve donned a lead straitjacket ., 大概你会感到失去活力 , 瘫痪 , 似乎你穿上了铅制的紧身衣.

list.abs: Idleness enervates the will to succeed., 懒惰削弱了成功的决心.

bind fetter使衰弱，使衰老 enfeeble enervatedebilitate weaken

entry.tran: 乏力的;衰弱的;无精打采的
entry.def: If you feel enervated, you feel tired and weak.

example.ex: Warm winds make many people feel enervated and depressed.
example.tran: 暖风让很多人觉得乏力沮丧。

auth_sentence.content: Unfortunately, almost everything in the movie feels flat and enervated.
auth_sentence.res_content: Unfortunately, almost everything in the movie feels flat and enervated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unfortunately, almost everything in the movie feels flat and enervated.

auth_sentence.content: She was enervated and chafed by the excitements and disappointments of the previous months.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was enervated and chafed by the excitements and disappointments of the previous months.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was enervated and chafed by the excitements and disappointments of the previous months.

auth_sentence.content: Bale, whose diet had left him severely enervated, looked wearily at the curtain of foliage into which he would soon run.
